H0.text: Sunlight travels from the Sun to warm Earth is an example of conduction.

H1.text: Boiling water in a pot warming a spoon inside the pot is an example of conduction.

H2.text: A fire in a fireplace warms the air in a room is an example of conduction.

H3.text: Cold water heated in a microwave oven is an example of conduction.

A4.text: Heat transfer by radiation occurs when microwaves, infrared radiation, visible light, or another form of electromagnetic radiation is emitted or absorbed. An obvious example is the warming of the Earth by the Sun.

A5.text: Heat is conducted from the hotplate of an electric stove to the bottom of a saucepan in contact with it.
